title: To the Lighthouse - best describes the narration

content.question: Which of the following best describes the way the passage is narrated?

choices.label: The reader’s perspective is limited to Mrs. Ramsay’s point of view.
The reader views the scene the way that Charles Tansley does.
The narrator shifts the point of view from one character to the other.
The narrator maintains an ironic distance from both characters.

content.answer: The narrator shifts the point of view from one character to the other.

skill.text: Skill 4.C: Identify and describe details, diction, or syntax in a text that reveal a narrator's or speaker's perspective.
